name: Precaine
contraindications: application directions : topical best results apply previously dried oral mucosa cotton swab similar applicator adequate control pain . removal excess saliva application minimizes dilution anesthetic permits maximum penetration . one ounce ( 28g ) per patient applied 24 hour period .
adverseReactions: precaine contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity amine quinoline type anesthetics .
contraindications_original:
Application Directions:
                  
                     For topical use only
                     For best results apply to previously dried oral mucosa with cotton swab or similar applicator for adequate control of pain.
                     Removal of excess saliva during application minimizes dilution of the anesthetic and permits maximum penetration.
                     Not more than one ounce (28g) per patient should be applied during a 24 hour period.
adverseReactions_original: Precaine is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to amine or quinoline type anesthetics.
